intro: Bufonia macrosperma var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered bufonia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. This species is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is known for its fibrous roots and mucilaginous properties. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical habitats.
